title: Classic Bridge Clubs
description: Do you remember the golden age of contract bridge? Test your knowledge of this beloved card game and social tradition!

questions.question: How many players are needed for a standard game of contract bridge?
In bridge, what are the four players traditionally called based on their compass positions?
Which famous bridge expert wrote the definitive books on bidding and play, including 'Contract Bridge Complete'?
What is the term for the phase of bridge where players communicate the strength and distribution of their hands?
What happens to the 'dummy' hand after the bidding is won?
options: It is shuffled back into the deck
The dummy player plays it normally
It is laid face-up on the table and played by the declarer

questions.question: What term describes the suit chosen to outrank all other suits during a particular hand?
What were weekly neighborhood bridge gatherings, often hosted in members' homes on a rotating basis, called?
What form of competitive bridge, played in clubs and tournaments, uses pre-dealt hands so all tables play the same deals?
What was the traditional refreshment custom at many home bridge club meetings?
options: Light desserts and coffee or tea served by the hostess

questions.question: Which Egyptian-born actor was also known as one of the world's best bridge players?
What does 'no trump' mean in a bridge bid?
options: The hand is played without any suit being trump
No one can play any cards

questions.question: What organization governs competitive bridge in the United States?
What newspaper feature helped millions of Americans learn bridge strategy during the mid-20th century?
